name: Rutabaga Soup With Bacon and Sage
description: This velvety rutabaga soup is the creation of Guillaume Delaune, the chef at Kingsbrae Arms in St. Andrews, New Brunswick. Enriched with maple syrup and garnished with bacon, it makes a lovely first course or appetizer.
keywords: appetizer, side dish, bacon, heavy cream, rutabaga, fall, winter
recipeIngredient: 1 medium-large rutabaga, 6 to 7 ounces, peeled and diced
4 ounces smoked slab bacon, diced fine

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large saucepan on low. Add onion, sprinkle with salt, cover and cook until onion is soft but not brown. Add rutabaga and garlic and cook, covered, about 20 minutes, until rutabaga can be pierced with a knife. Meanwhile, in a 3-quart saucepan, bring cream, milk and stock to a simmer.

Season rutabaga with pepper and stir in maple syrup. Cook for a few minutes, then add cream mixture. Simmer uncovered until rutabaga is soft, another 15 minutes or so. Purée in a blender and return to a clean saucepan. Season with salt and pepper.
Cook bacon in a small skillet until lightly browned. Remove to a couple of sheets of paper towel. Add sage leaves to bacon fat and cook on high heat a minute or so, until crisp. Drain on paper towel.
Reheat soup, check seasonings and serve with bacon and fried sage scattered on top.
